tasks: Review the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) and identify 3 areas where you can improve your UX Fundamentals. Create a list of specific changes to implement in your next project.
Redesign a simple webpage using only Hick’s Law, Tesler’s Law, Aesthetic-Usability Effect, and Laws of UX as guidelines. This will help you understand how these principles apply to UI design.
Create a mind map or diagram illustrating the 8-point grid system for navigation. Practice applying this system to your portfolio's navigation.

Conduct a self-assessment of your wireframing skills. Create 5 new wireframes for a hypothetical product, focusing on error states and user flow. Compare these to your previous work and identify areas for improvement.
Apply the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to 2 existing products or services. Document 3 pain points for each product and brainstorm potential solutions.
Redesign a familiar UI element (e.g., a login form) using only UI Craft & Visual Design principles. Focus on creating an intuitive and aesthetically pleasing experience.
Create a case study of a successful product redesign that incorporated UX Fundamentals effectively. Analyze the design decisions made and how they contributed to the product's success.
Develop a simple prototype using a tool like Figma or Sketch, applying the principles learned from Laws of UX. Test your prototype with 2 users and gather feedback.
Write a short article (approx. 500 words) discussing the importance of UX Fundamentals in Strategic Lead design. Share your insights on how these principles can be applied to real-world projects.
Design a comprehensive user research study for a new product idea. Develop a plan for data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Create a visual design system for a hypothetical company, incorporating the principles learned from Laws of UX. Document your design decisions and rationale.

Develop a capstone project that showcases your skills in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, Product Thinking & Strategy, and Collaboration & Communication. Present your project to a peer group or mentor.

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive user-centered design across entire product lines, leveraging your expertise in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, and Product Thinking & Strategy. By combining your exceptional skills with collaboration and communication abilities, you can shape the future of products that delight users and drive business success.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Hick's Law to Inform Navigation Design
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, understanding how users respond to time-based constraints in navigation can significantly improve the user experience.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites and identify instances where Hick's Law is applied (e.g., dropdown menus, hover effects). Document your findings and suggest improvements
Create a usability test plan to evaluate how users respond to different navigation options (e.g., quick links vs. scrolling menus) on a new website prototype
Design 2 alternative navigation solutions that incorporate Hick's Law principles and conduct A/B testing to determine user preference

topics.name: Crafting Effective Micro-Interactions for Strategic Lead Designers
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, understanding the role of micro-interactions in enhancing user engagement can elevate your design decisions.
practice_points: Research 5 successful examples of micro-interactions (e.g., loading animations, button hover effects) and analyze their design principles. Create a style guide for incorporating these interactions into future designs
Design 3 interactive prototypes that incorporate micro-interactions to enhance user experience (e.g., loading screens, form validation feedback)
Conduct usability testing on existing websites with ineffective micro-interactions and provide recommendations for improvement

topics.name: Evaluating the Aesthetic-Usability Effect in Strategic Lead Design
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, grasping how aesthetics impact user experience can lead to more effective design decisions.
practice_points: Conduct 2 usability tests evaluating the effect of color schemes on user engagement (e.g., warm vs. cool tones). Document findings and suggest recommendations for future designs
Analyze 5 existing websites with varying aesthetic approaches (e.g., minimalism, maximalism) and identify which design elements contribute to their overall usability
Design a comprehensive visual design system incorporating the Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should prioritize UX fundamentals to ensure a solid foundation for product development.
insights.detailed: A strong understanding of UX principles is crucial in Strategic Lead roles, as it enables designers to create user-centered products that meet business objectives. However, there may be a gap between the expected level of UX expertise and the actual performance of Strategic Leads in this area.
actionable: Take online courses or attend workshops to improve understanding of UX principles and design systems
Review industry benchmarks and best practices for UX design in product development
Conduct regular self-assessments to identify areas for improvement in UX fundamentals

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should focus on refining UI craft and visual design skills to create visually appealing and user-friendly products.
insights.detailed: While Strategic Leads may not be expected to be expert designers, they do need to have a solid understanding of UI principles and visual design best practices. This will enable them to effectively communicate design decisions to stakeholders and ensure that products meet user needs and business objectives.
actionable: Join online communities or forums to stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in UI craft and visual design
Review design systems and style guides to improve understanding of consistent design language
Participate in design critiques or peer review sessions to develop feedback skills

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should prioritize user research and validation to ensure that products meet user needs and business objectives.
insights.detailed: Effective user research and validation are critical components of successful product development. Strategic Leads should strive to conduct thorough user research, gather feedback from stakeholders, and validate design decisions to ensure that products meet user needs and business objectives.
actionable: Develop a user research plan and methodology to guide future research efforts
Conduct regular usability testing or A/B testing to validate design decisions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather feedback from stakeholders

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should focus on developing product thinking and strategy skills to drive business outcomes.
insights.detailed: While Strategic Leads may not be expected to be expert product managers, they do need to have a solid understanding of product development principles and strategies. This will enable them to effectively communicate design decisions to stakeholders and ensure that products meet user needs and business objectives.
actionable: Take online courses or attend workshops to improve understanding of product development principles and strategies
Review industry benchmarks and best practices for product thinking and strategy
Develop a product roadmap or vision statement to guide future product development

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should prioritize collaboration and communication skills to effectively work with cross-functional teams.
insights.detailed: Effective collaboration and communication are critical components of successful Strategic Lead roles. Strategic Leads should strive to build strong relationships with stakeholders, communicate design decisions clearly, and facilitate effective feedback loops to ensure that products meet user needs and business objectives.
actionable: Develop a communication plan or style guide to guide future interactions with stakeholders
Join online communities or forums to improve collaboration and communication skills
Participate in team-building activities or workshops to develop trust and rapport with cross-functional teams
